item.title: Take_english
item.description: source: https://www.talkenglish.com/ I. English Speaking Basic I I’m I’m in/at/on

item.title: Words In Reality
item.description: 1. In relation to in relationship to something, in the context of Ex: The drugs is being studied for possible beneficial effects in relation to migraine headaches. She checked the map to see where Miami in relation to Orlando (~ compared with) I have several comments to make in relation to the subject at hand. (~ reference to) 2. in terms of talk about something then clarifying a specific perspective

item.title: Grammar Worth Noting
item.description: 1. Be of + N The constructor Be Of + Noun is virtually the same as Be + Adj except it sounds more formal. You can think of it as to be of a certain class or of a certain type. Among the best ~ Of the best Ex: The book is of interest Can I be of any help? 2. Was/Were + Doing 3. It vs That(This) both are pronoun IT: without nuance This/that: with nuance (emphasis), also repalce whole phrase/sentence 4.

item.title: Hieu's Corpus
item.description: Ronaldo Interview Surely that must concern you You have never revealed and I don’t think you ever intent to reveal The thing that occurred to me while watching the film was You don’t owe the world an explanation but you obviously feel that you would owe him the truth Do you ever worry about … How do you approach that If you are in my shoes, what you gonna do?

item.title: British Council Learning English for teen
item.description: I. Vocabulary 1. Accessories rucksack scarf bracelet earrings glasses What accesories do you wear? I don’t usually wear many accessories. In my daily work, I wear my rucksack to carry my laptop. I also wear a watch on my left wrist, a hap and sunglassess if I need to go outside. I also wear a belt in case my trousers is quite big. In the winter, I wear the scarf to keep my body warm.

item.title: ESL - Listening Series
item.description: Intermediate 1. A Student Credit Card source: https://www.esl-lab.com/intermediate/credit-cards/ quiz -> plural: quizzes shred Come over (phrasal verb) -> to visit someone’s home Drop off That is the least I can do Over (preposition) -> during spend yourself in a hole impulse (n) a sudden desire pay thing back

item.title: Part of Speech and its function
[Reading] 01 - 7 Incredible Resources of English Reading
item.description: FluentU - 7 Incredible Resources Designed to Help You Learn English Reading link: https://www.fluentu.com/blog/english/learn-english-reading-4/ 1. The more that you read, the more things you will know -> The more + S V (simple tense), the more S + will + V. 2. Most people are familiar with St 3. He couldn’t have been more right! 4. The fact is that whether you are a natural reading lover like myself or merely read when you have to.

item.title: First_article
item.description: LOL 24/05/2021 This is the first article to help Hd7 improve his active english skill, ie writing and speaking not just passive english skill such as listening and reading. Yeah here we go, everystep (though small) make a huge impact in the future.
